div.div:
FCWorker::
run
()
While true:
`Select` all channels.
case
fc_avail
:
flush_and_compact( None );
case
fc_request
:
flush_and_compact( Some(snap_head) );
response_tx.send( () );
case
min_held_list_ver
:
dangling_nodes
.gc_old_nodes( mhlv );
case
is_terminating
:
break;
poll_held_list_vers_then_gc();

li.span: When actually committing, handle this anomaly:
Problem: Actually committed CommittedUnit vs never pushed CommittedUnit are indistinguishable.
Ensure that any crash during commitment propagates, s.t. further commitments are impossible.

ul.li: Flush some info to disk, a second time, _after_ the node is pushed to the LL.
where the second info could be e.g.
replacement_num is flushed as None; then push to LL; then replacement_num is finalized
CRC is initially missing; then push to LL; then CRC is flushed

li.span: F+C goes through recent commits, and sets replacement_num=Some(zero)
(This is too complicated and likely causes some incorrectness.)

div.div:
FCWorker::
flush_and_compact
( spap_head: Opt< *const ListNode<_> > )
With db_state_guard =
db_state
.
lock_shared
() :
/* This guard is held for the duration of the flushing-and-compaction. */
/* It's also likely correct to hold a guard over a smaller scope, e.g. only during `
do_flush_and_compact
()`;
but doing so would make it harder to reason about the correctness of concurrent interoperation with SICr,
and would also increase the frequency of acquisitions and releases. */
if arg snap_head is None :
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
/* Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They'relumped in here for legibility. */
snap_head := at
list
head ...
If the existing head is a dummy w/ {
is_fence
=false } : don't update and don't push.
Else : push new dummy w/ {
hold_count
=0,
is_fence
=false }
/* If the existing non-null head is a fence, the we do push a non-fence. */
traverse_and_compact( snap_head );

div.div:
FCJob::
do_flush_and_compact
( units, skip_tombstones ) -> Opt< CommittedUnit >
If {units.len() > 1} or {units contains 1+ MemLog(s)} :
Create a new empty CompactedUnit.
For each of {PI; and SIs in
scnd_idxs
regardless of `
is_readable
`} :
K-merge across the slice --> produce one SSTable.
If skipping tombstones, do so.
If the newly produced SSTable is non-empty :
Assign the new SSTable into the new CommittedUnit.
If the newly produced CommittedUnit contains 1+ non-empty SSTable(s) :
On disk, serialize CommitInfo with ...
commit_ver_hi_incl = max in slice
commit_ver_lo_incl = min in slcie
replacement_num = (max in slice) + 1
Convert the CompactedUnit into CommittedUnit.
Return the CommittedUnit.
Else :
Remove the CompactedUnit from disk.
Return "empty".
Else :
Return "no change".

div.div:
DB::
delete_scnd_idx
( sv_spec )
With
db_state
.
lock_shared
() :
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ] is Some, and its
is_readable
== false
Return error.
With
db_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ] is Some, and its
is_readable
== false
Return error.
scnd_idxs
.remove( sv_spec );
Serialize ScndIdxsState to disk.

div.div:
Txn::
try_commit
()
staging
.flush();
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
/* Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They're lumped in here for legibility. */
If
snap_commit_ver
!=
curr_commit_ver
:
snap
.tail_excl.
hold_count
-= 1; if
snap
.tail_exclis Some
If (prior
snap
.tail_excl became non-held) :
fc_avail
.send( () );
snap
.tail_excl = Some(
snap
.head_excl);
snap
.head_excl = at
list
head ...
If the existing head is a dummy : dummy.
hold_count
+= 1;
Else : push new dummy w/ {
hold_count
=1,
is_fence
=false }
snap_commit_ver
=
curr_commit_ver
;
held_list_vers
.remove(
snap_list_ver
);
held_list_vers
.add(
curr_list_ver
);
snap_list_ver
=
curr_list_ver
;
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
return "need to check for conflict";
Else :
curr_commit_ver
+= 1;
committed_unit := CommittedUnit::from(
staging
.take().unwrap(),
curr_commit_ver
);
/* Serializing is not cheap, and we're doing it under mutex guard! */
On disk, serialize CommitInfo with ...
commit_ver_lo_incl == commit_ver_hi_incl :=
curr_commit_ver
replacement_num := 0
In memory, move each WritableMemLog into ReadonlyMemLog.
node := Box( ListNode( ... committed_unit ... ) )
list
.push_head
( node );
snap
.tail_excl.
hold_count
-= 1; if
snap
.tail_exclis Some
snap
.head_excl.
hold_count
-= 1;
fc_avail
.send( () );
/* Notify unconditionally. The list is definitely F+C'able, due to the presence of a new MemLog. */
held_list_vers
.remove(
snap_list_ver
);
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
return "just committed";

Txn::
has_conflict()
committed_units :=
snap
.filter( keep CommittedUnit and ignore Dummy );
For each CommittedUnit :
For each of {PI and SIs}that was written-to in
staging
:
If {
dependent_itvs_*
<--> CommittedEntrySet } overlap :
Return "yes conflict".
Return "no conflict".

reset
()
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
/* Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They'relumped in here for legibility. */
snap
.tail_excl.
hold_count
-= 1; if
snap
.tail_exclis Some
snap
.head_excl.
hold_count
-= 1;
If (
prior
snap
.tail_excl and/or
snap
.head_excl became non-held) :
fc_avail
.send( () )
snap
.tail_excl= None;
snap
.head_excl = at
list
head ...
If the existing head is a dummy : dummy.
hold_count
+= 1;
Else : push new dummy w/ {
hold_count
=1,
is_fence
=false }
snap_commit_ver
=
curr_commit_ver
;
held_list_vers
.remove(
snap_list_ver
);
held_list_vers
.add(
curr_list_ver
);
snap_list_ver
=
curr_list_ver
;
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
snap_vec
= None;
dependent_itvs_prim
.clear();
dependent_itvs_scnds
.clear();
if
staging
is Some :
staging
.clear();

div.div:
/* All these methdos are public to the client callback. */
Txn::
get_pk_one
( pk )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk,pk) );
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap
.map( (unit) -> unit.prim );
Get one from [stg, snap]. Return result.
Txn::
get_pk_range
( pk_lo, pk_hi )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk_lo,pk_hi) );
if
snap_vec
is None: collect it from
snap
.
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap_vec
.map( (unit) -> unit.prim );
K-merge [stg, snap]. Return result.
Txn::
get_sv_range
( sv_spec, sv_lo, sv_hi )
/* This is a simplistic query engine, which depends on exactly one index. */
If
scnd_idxs
[sv_spec] doesn't exist or
is_readable
==false: return failure.
si_num :=
scnd_idxs
[sv_spec].si_num;
If
dependent_itvs_scnds
[si_num]doesn't exist: create new empty.
dependent_itvs_scnds
[si_num].add( (sv_lo,sv_hi) );
if
snap_vec
is None: collect it from
snap
.
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.scnds.get(si_num) );
snap :=
snap_vec
.map( (unit) -> unit.scnds.get(si_num) );
K-merge [stg, snap]. Return result.
Txn::
put
( pk, new_pv )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk,pk) );
/* We must treat concurrent writes on the same PK as a conflict, because they generally invalidate deltas on SIs in staging. */
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap
.map( (unit) -> unit.prim );
old_pv := Get one from [stg, snap];
If
staging
is None: create new empty.
For each si_num in
scnd_idxs
:
/* Assess all SIs, regardless of `is_readable
`. */
If there is a delta for this SI:
If
staging
.scnds[si_num] doesn't exist: create new empty.
staging
.scnds[si_num].put( the_delta );
staging
.prim
.put( (PK,PV) );

div.div:
FCWorker::
poll_held_list_vers_then_gc
()
/* F+C worker no longer attempts to do any F+C'ing, and instead only waits to complete GC'ing.
Hence, F+C is interested in list_ver info only, not commit_ver info. */
/*
min_held_list_ver
does not inform whether
curr_list_ver
is held or not. But this is irrelevant for the purpose of GC.*/
While true :
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
If (
min_held_list_ver
==
curr_list_ver
) or (
held_list_vers
is empty) :
/* Either check is correct. */
break;
Sleep a bit.
For each (_, nodes) in
dangling_nodes
:
For each node in nodes :
Remove files. Drop memory.

run
( db, retry_limit, client_cb )
With db_state_guard =

.
lock_shared
() :
/* This guard is held for the duration of the txn. */
If
is_terminating
== true :
Return error.
txn := Txn::new( ... );
Make the txn go through the state transitions.
Return what client_cb returns.

div.div:
SICrJob::
do_create
( &Arc< SVSpec > )
With
db_state
.
lock_shared
() :
If
is_terminating
== true :
Return error.
If
scnd_idxs
.has_key( sv_spec ) :
Return error.
With
db_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
If
is_terminating
== true :
Return error.
If
scnd_idxs
.has_key( sv_spec ) :
Return error.
si_num
:=
next_scnd_idx_num
.fetch_inc();
scnd_idxs
.insert( sv_spec, ( si_num,
is_readable
=false ) );
Serialize ScndIdxsState to disk.
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
snap_head
:= {
hold_count
=0,
is_fence
=true };
list.push_head
(
snap_head
);
/* Push. Never update. */
curr_commit_ver
+= 1;
output_commit_ver
:=
curr_commit_ver
;
/* Comment */
While
db_state
was exclusively locked, ...
No txn was in progress, and no new txns could start.
F+C was not traversing the LL.
After the lock on
db_state
is released, ...
New txns can start again. New commitments will write deltas to the new (not yet readable) SI.
F+C can traverse the LL again. The traversal is guaranteed to stop at or above
snap_head
.
(tx, rx) := oneshot::channel();
req := FlushAndCompactRequest{
snap_head
, tx };
fc_request
.send( req );
rx.receive();
committed_unit := create_unit( ... );
If committed_unit is Some :
node := Box( ListNode( ... committed_unit ... ) );
node.next =
snap_front_excl
.next.load();
snap_front_excl
.next.store( node );
snap_front_excl
.
is_fence
.store( false );
With
db_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ].
is_readable
= true ;
Serialize ScndIdxsState to disk.
/* B/c we need to write to disk, we need an exclusive guard.
Hence it's not useful to make is_readable be typed AtomicBool. */
fc_avail
.send( () );
/*
When F+C is notified, it acquires a shared lock on
db_state
. Hence, we should notify after having locked (and released)
db_state
for our needs, in the previous step.
*/

div.div:
FCJob::
record_list_ver_change
( cut_nodes )
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
penult_list_ver :=
curr_list_ver;
curr_list_ver
+= 1;
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
dangling_nodes
.push_back( ( penult_list_ver, cut_nodes ) );
If
min_held_list_ver
was advanced :
danling_nodes
.gc_old_nodes(
min_held_list_ver
);
/* We bump curr_list_ver per segment.
Alternatively, we could choose to bump per traversal. */
